author: naquoya
body:
Since making my first hesitant little footsteps on the Internet back in 1995, I have watched with interest how this revolutionary technology has impacted upon humanity. I have tried to keep up with it but life has steered me in many directions, taking my attention to other areas, either out of a need for survival, or just boredom at the state of current events. But every time I drifted from a pursuit of furthering my knowledge of all things Internet related I would find something to lure me back. Something to pique my curiosity. My major problem is that I seem to suffer from the disease of dabbling! So I never really allowed my interests to develop beyond the superficial. I never set out for this to be the case. Over the past 12 months I have started to rectify this situation. Taking my interest in computer programming to the next level by actually taking a course in it. Taking a speed reading course so as to take in data and retain it in a useful manner. And attempting to further my knowledge of both Bitcoin and the Blockchain.

The Blockchain Revolution

Although I was aware of Bitcoin when it was still in single figures, I never pursued it. Firstly I just didn't get it. Secondly I was broke at the time, so it made no difference. I missed an opportunity, but I missed it on several levels. But what I did gain was a new interest. Bitcoin intrigued me, and the subject kept popping up in my universe, reinforcing the notion that I needed to pursue my studies, and not just superficially, into this new area of technology. But it wasn't until I started to get my head around the technology that went hand in hand with Bitcoin, The Blockchain, that I really started to get it. This is not just "play money" as several people tried to tell me. This is a technology that can, and most likely will revolutionise the financial sector. And this is what I started to witness happening. 


The concept of the Blockchain appeals to me on many levels. The creation of a decentralised currency, denying any government the ability to inflate the money supply at will was of enormous interest to me. Having been an astute observer of authority and power, and those who pursue it, I haven't failed to notice that in most cases, where there is power there is corruption. And I have never had any interest in seeking to change that corrupt culture from within. I honestly do not believe it is possible. The self interest of the corrupt would not allow for any internal dissent. From my observation the only change that occurs with the authority classes is who has authority. Who has the baton passed to now? 

But I am not a pessimist. I do believe in change. I do believe in the evolutionary process of humanity to better itself. And I believed I was witnessing it first hand in the development and implementation of the Blockchain. As Buckminster Fuller wisely stated:

“You never change things by fighting the existing reality. To change something, build a new model that makes the existing model obsolete.”

Arriving at Planet Steemit

Which is what leads me to where I find myself currently: Planet Steemit. I have been here for about 3 weeks, having seen posts on FaceBook discussing it. I was never a huge fan of FaceBook, and used it sparingly, so I do appreciate the irony that the current King of the social media world is what drew my attention to it's potential usurper: Steemit. I started dabbling (that old habit of mine!) in the post making process, and put together some material to share. It never got me very far. Not just financially, but in terms of overall attention. But that's ok. I was more than interested in this new technology. In this marrying of Blockchain technology and social media. 


So I started reading up as much as I could. Trying to see if I could understand how this all worked. Sure I saw some people getting several thousand dollars for their posts. So I tried to understand why. Some brought a ready made audience with them to Steemit. Ok, that makes sense. Others were here from the beginning. Some are just excellent writers and producers of content. But one thing stood out to me: write. Write comments, write posts, communicate. Thumbs up if you like a post or comment. Build a network. So I went to work on it. Slowly, at first. The introvert in me doesn't like sticking his head out too far! But one thing I have found about this site. It has made it far easier to feel comfortable enough to express my thoughts. 

Testing the Waters

After having written several posts that expressed some thoughts of mine, I decided to go a bit deeper, and reveal something a little bit more personal. I wrote the following post: 

How Cancer Taught Me Happiness

I received some positive feedback, and it even registered a few cents. I have been writing on the internet, on a casual basis, for many years, and I had just made more than in all those years! It's not about the money, as I'm not going to retire on that anytime soon. It's about observing, and participating in this new phenomenon of a social media platform that actually encourages and rewards social interaction. A platform that rewards content.


Over the next couple of days I wrote and posted two more articles:

Sometimes We Just Need to Rage Against the Machine

and:

Mental Slavery and the Fear of the Unknown

and I couldn't believe it when even more people started to read, comment, and like. People were including my work in lists of their daily favourites. This helped me find other content worth reading and exploring, and the network capabilities of this platform started to reveal itself even more. The amount of quality work, and the subjects of interest that I was finding was growing. 


Steemit Inspiration

I felt inspired to write one more article: 

Self-Ownership: What Role Do Our Emotions Play?

When I woke in the morning, I turned on the computer to catch up on events, and noticed my article showed over $200 next to it. "What's in my coffee?" I thought. "That can't be real can it?" But it was. 


And my excitement for the Steemit platform grew even more. I don't think I will be touching those funds (except to share some with those who have helped me along the way) because if I understand the concept of Steem Power correctly (and I am still learning), it holds great benefit, and the more one has the more voting power one has. And it benefits all of the Steemit universe in the long run. Which is a primary concern of mine. The fact that I was recognised enough to receive that level of financial reward is very gratifying. But ultimately I would like to see Steemit grow and reach it's potential. 


So when it comes to Steemit I wont be dabbling. I intend to learn all I can (having already started), and use this practical experience and network to further my long overdue in-depth understanding of crypto's, the Blockchain, and their potential to revolution this world of ours.

Websites That I Have Found Useful On My Steemit Journey

https://steemstats.com

https://steemit.chat/home

http://steemtools.com/

And for those who wish to understand more behind the Steemit project, the Steem Whitepaper:

https://steem.io/SteemWhitePaper.pdf
title: Life On Planet Steemit: Re-Imagining the Internet
